item.title: War via TIKTOK: New tool for propaganda machine...

item.title: 120,000 flee...
item.description:
apnews.com
WARSAW, Poland (AP) — Nearly 120,000 people have so far fled Ukraine into Poland and other neighboring countries in the wake of Russian invasion, the U.N. refugee agency said on Saturday. The number was going up fast as Ukrainians grabbed their belongings and rushed to escape from a deadly Russian onslaught on their nation, including an attempt to take the capital.
